intro: Crepis gossweileri, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and hairy, basal leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its life cycle is adapted to the short growing season of mountain environments, with flowering occurring in late summer. Crepis gossweileri is often found in alpine meadows and is a member of the genus Crepis, which includes many other species with similar ecological preferences.
